summary.long: Matthew is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesse became the father of King David. David the king became the father of Solomon by her who had been Uriah’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers at the time of the exile to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azor became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this: After his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, don’t be afraid to take to yourself Mary as your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She shall give birth to a son. You shall name him Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all this has happened that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, the virgin shall be with child,
    and shall give birth to a son.
They shall call his name Immanuel,”
    which is, being interpreted, “God with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and didn’t know her sexually until she had given birth to her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Where is he who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘You Bethlehem, land of Judah,
    are in no way least among the princes of Judah;
for out of you shall come a governor
    who shall shepherd my people, Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and learned from them exactly what time the star appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said, “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them until it came and stood over where the young child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night and departed into Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called my son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men, was exceedingly angry, and sent out and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
    lamentation, weeping and great mourning,
Rachel weeping for her children;
    she wouldn’t be comforted,
    because they are no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child’s life are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets that he will be called a Nazarene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying,
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
    make the way of the Lord ready!
    Make his paths straight!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now John himself wore clothing made of camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruit worthy of repentance!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t think to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father,’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the ax lies at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But John would have hindered him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, answering, said to him, “Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry afterward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of God’s mouth.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written,
‘He will command his angels concerning you,’ and,
‘On their hands they will bear you up,
    so that you don’t dash your foot against a stone.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Again, it is written, ‘You shall not test the Lord, your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,
    toward the sea, beyond the Jordan,
    Galilee of the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say, “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from beyond the Jordan followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He opened his mouth and taught them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed are the poor in spirit,
    for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who mourn,
    for they shall be comforted.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the gentle,
    for they shall inherit the earth.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
    for they shall be filled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the merciful,
    for they shall obtain mercy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the pure in heart,
    for they shall see God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are the peacemakers,
    for they shall be called children of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake,
    for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Blessed are you when people reproach you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for my sake.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can’t be hidden.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Neither do you light a lamp and put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand; and it shines to all who are in the house.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Even so, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I didn’t come to destroy, but to fulfill.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For most certainly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, whoever shall break one of these least commandments and teach others to do so, shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, there is no way you will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘You shall not murder;’ and ‘Whoever murders will be in danger of the judgment.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause will be in danger of the judgment. Whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca!’ will be in danger of the council. Whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be in danger of the fire of Gehenna.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Agree with your adversary quickly while you are with him on the way; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, you shall by no means get out of there until you have paid the last penny.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery;’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “It was also said, ‘Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce,’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I tell you that whoever puts away his wife, except for the cause of sexual immorality, makes her an adulteress; and whoever marries her when she is put away commits adultery.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Again you have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘You shall not make false vows, but shall perform to the Lord your vows,’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but I tell you, don’t swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Neither shall you swear by your head, for you can’t make one hair white or black.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes’ and your ‘No’ be ‘No.’ Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you, don’t resist him who is evil; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If anyone sues you to take away your coat, let him have your cloak also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give to him who asks you, and don’t turn away him who desires to borrow from you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that you may be children of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the just and the unjust.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you only greet your friends, what more do you do than others? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Be careful that you don’t do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them, or else you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, when you do merciful deeds, don’t sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when you do merciful deeds, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand does,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that your merciful deeds may be in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most certainly, I tell you, they have received their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you, when you pray, enter into your inner room, and having shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In praying, don’t use vain repetitions as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore don’t be like them, for your Father knows what things you need before you ask him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Pray like this:
“‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Let your Kingdom come.
    Let your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Give us today our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Forgive us our debts,
    as we also forgive our debtors.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Bring us not into temptation,
    but deliver us from the evil one.
For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you don’t forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Moreover when you fast, don’t be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces that they may be seen by men to be fasting. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t lay up treasures for yourselves on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don’t break through and steal;
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: for where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can’t serve both God and Mammon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: See the birds of the sky, that they don’t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you of much more value than they?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Which of you by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won’t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Therefore don’t be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘With what will we be clothed?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For the Gentiles seek after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But seek first God’s Kingdom and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore don’t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day’s own evil is sufficient.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t judge, so that you won’t be judged.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For with whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or how will you tell your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye,’ and behold, the beam is in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t give that which is holy to the dogs, neither throw your pearls before the pigs, lest perhaps they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Ask, and it will be given you. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and it will be opened for you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or who is there among you who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Or if he asks for a fish, who will give him a serpent?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore, whatever you desire for men to do to you, you shall also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Enter in by the narrow gate; for the gate is wide and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and there are many who enter in by it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: How narrow is the gate and the way is restricted that leads to life! There are few who find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravening wolves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: By their fruits you will know them. Do you gather grapes from thorns or figs from thistles?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Even so, every good tree produces good fruit, but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A good tree can’t produce evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Every tree that doesn’t grow good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore by their fruits you will know them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven, but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Many will tell me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty works?’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then I will tell them, ‘I never knew you. Depart from me, you who work iniquity.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Everyone therefore who hears these words of mine and does them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it didn’t fall, for it was founded on the rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone who hears these words of mine and doesn’t do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it fell—and its fall was great.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a leper came to him and worshiped him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.” Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “See that you tell nobody; but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When he came into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking him for help,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Lord, my servant lies in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The centurion answered, “Lord, I’m not worthy for you to come under my roof. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am also a man under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and tell another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and tell my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, he marveled and said to those who followed, “Most certainly I tell you, I haven’t found so great a faith, not even in Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: but the children of the Kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way. Let it be done for you as you have believed.” His servant was healed in that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. So she got up and served him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying, “He took our infirmities and bore our diseases.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A scribe came and said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Another of his disciples said to him, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a violent storm came up on the sea, so much that the boat was covered with the waves; but he was asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples came to him and woke him up, saying, “Save us, Lord! We are dying!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The men marveled, saying, “What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two people possessed by demons met him there, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that nobody could pass that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, they cried out, saying, “What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding far away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons begged him, saying, “If you cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of pigs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “Go!”
They came out and went into the herd of pigs; and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea and died in the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who fed them fled and went away into the city and told everything, including what happened to those who were possessed with demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged that he would depart from their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entered into a boat and crossed over, and came into his own city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, they brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man blasphemes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Get up, and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins—” (then he said to the paralytic), “Get up, and take up your mat, and go to your house.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He arose and departed to his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus passed by from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax collection office. He said to him, “Follow me.” He got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But you go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then John’s disciples came to him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch would tear away from the garment, and a worse hole is made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither do people put new wine into old wineskins, or else the skins would burst, and the wine be spilled, and the skins ruined. No, they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up and followed him, as did his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a woman who had a discharge of blood for twelve years came behind him, and touched the fringe of his garment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for she said within herself, “If I just touch his garment, I will be made well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said, “Daughter, cheer up! Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the crowd in noisy disorder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he said to them, “Make room, because the girl isn’t dead, but sleeping.”
They were ridiculing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowd was sent out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The report of this went out into all that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus passed by from there, two blind men followed him, calling out and saying, “Have mercy on us, son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”
They told him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith be it done to you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then their eyes were opened. Jesus strictly commanded them, saying, “See that no one knows about this.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they went out and spread abroad his fame in all that land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went out, behold, a mute man who was demon possessed was brought to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees said, “By the prince of the demons, he casts out demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them because they were harassed and scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Pray therefore that the Lord of the harvest will send out laborers into his harvest.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He called to himself his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these. The first, Simon, who is called Peter; Andrew, his brother; James the son of Zebedee; John, his brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; Lebbaeus, who was also called Thaddaeus;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon the Zealot; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent these twelve out and commanded them, saying, “Don’t go among the Gentiles, and don’t enter into any city of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Rather, go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As you go, preach, saying, ‘The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, and cast out demons. Freely you received, so freely give.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t take any gold, silver, or brass in your money belts.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Take no bag for your journey, neither two coats, nor sandals, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Into whatever city or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy, and stay there until you go on.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As you enter into the household, greet it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If the household is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it isn’t worthy, let your peace return to you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t receive you or hear your words, as you go out of that house or that city, shake the dust off your feet.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Behold, I send you out as sheep among wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and harmless as doves.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they deliver you up, don’t be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given you in that hour what you will say.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next, for most certainly I tell you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel until the Son of Man has come.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more those of his household!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore don’t be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul. Rather, fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Aren’t two sparrows sold for an assarion coin? Not one of them falls to the ground apart from your Father’s will.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, I will also confess him before my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But whoever denies me before men, I will also deny him before my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Don’t think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn’t come to send peace, but a sword.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: A man’s foes will be those of his own household.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn’t worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who doesn’t take his cross and follow after me isn’t worthy of me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives him who sent me.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when John heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is he, of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom on the day of judgment, than for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, “Behold, your disciples do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, and those who were with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he entered into God’s house and ate the show bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, nor for those who were with him, but only for the priests?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath day the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath and are guiltless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you wouldn’t have condemned the guiltless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He departed from there and went into their synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a man with a withered hand. They asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?” so that they might accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What man is there among you who has one sheep, and if this one falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, won’t he grab on to it and lift it out?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees went out and conspired against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, perceiving that, withdrew from there. Great multitudes followed him; and he healed them all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and commanded them that they should not make him known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, my servant whom I have chosen,
    my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased.
I will put my Spirit on him.
    He will proclaim justice to the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not strive, nor shout,
    neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He won’t break a bruised reed.
    He won’t quench a smoking flax,
until he leads justice to victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his name, the nations will hope.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, was brought to him; and he healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the multitudes were amazed, and said, “Can this be the son of David?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, “This man does not cast out demons except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I by Beelzebul cast out demons, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons, then God’s Kingdom has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who is not with me is against me, and he who doesn’t gather with me, scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, either in this age, or in that which is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree corrupt and its fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good man out of his good treasure brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that every idle word that men speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, but no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the huge fish, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, someone greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an unclean spirit has gone out of a man, he passes through waterless places seeking rest, and doesn’t find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he says, ‘I will return into my house from which I came;’ and when he has come back, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he goes and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brothers stood outside, seeking to speak to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One said to him, “Behold, your mother and your brothers stand outside, seeking to speak to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered him who spoke to him, “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stretched out his hand toward his disciples, and said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the seaside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat and sat; and all the multitude stood on the beach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to them many things in parables, saying, “Behold, a farmer went out to sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sowed, some seeds fell by the roadside, and the birds came and devoured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn’t have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun had risen, they were scorched. Because they had no root, they withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others fell on good soil and yielded fruit: some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples came, and said to him, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but it is not given to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have abundance; but whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they don’t see, and hearing, they don’t hear, neither do they understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for this people’s heart has grown callous,
    their ears are dull of hearing,
    and they have closed their eyes;
or else perhaps they might perceive with their eyes,
    hear with their ears,
    understand with their heart,
and would turn again,
    and I would heal them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For most certainly I tell you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them; and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear, then, the parable of the farmer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When anyone hears the word of the Kingdom and doesn’t understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown by the roadside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What was sown on the rocky places, this is he who hears the word and immediately with joy receives it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet he has no root in himself, but endures for a while. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What was sown among the thorns, this is he who hears the word, but the cares of this age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What was sown on the good ground, this is he who hears the word and understands it, who most certainly bears fruit and produces, some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set another parable before them, saying, “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but while people slept, his enemy came and sowed darnel weeds also among the wheat, and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the blade sprang up and produced grain, then the darnel weeds appeared also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servants of the householder came and said to him, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where did these darnel weeds come from?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’
“The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and gather them up?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But he said, ‘No, lest perhaps while you gather up the darnel weeds, you root up the wheat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the harvest time I will tell the reapers, “First, gather up the darnel weeds, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set another parable before them, saying, “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took, and sowed in his field,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which indeed is smaller than all seeds. But when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke another parable to them. “The Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, until it was all leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes; and without a parable, he didn’t speak to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus sent the multitudes away, and went into the house. His disciples came to him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the darnel weeds of the field.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the field is the world, the good seeds are the children of the Kingdom, and the darnel weeds are the children of the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As therefore the darnel weeds are gathered up and burned with fire; so will it be at the end of this age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will gather out of his Kingdom all things that cause stumbling and those who do iniquity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like treasure hidden in the field, which a man found and hid. In his joy, he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a merchant seeking fine pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had and bought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered some fish of every kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which, when it was filled, fishermen drew up on the beach. They sat down and gathered the good into containers, but the bad they threw away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it will be in the end of the world. The angels will come and separate the wicked from among the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you understood all these things?”
They answered him, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Therefore every scribe who has been made a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a householder, who brings out of his treasure new and old things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these parables, he departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this man get this wisdom and these mighty works?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother called Mary, and his brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aren’t all of his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all of these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were offended by him.
But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country and in his own house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He didn’t do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptizer. He is risen from the dead. That is why these powers work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John said to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced among them and pleased Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she should ask.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She, being prompted by her mother, said, “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptizer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king was grieved, but for the sake of his oaths and of those who sat at the table with him, he commanded it to be given,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sent and beheaded John in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the young lady; and she brought it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples came, took the body, and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat to a deserted place apart. When the multitudes heard it, they followed him on foot from the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them and healed their sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, his disciples came to him, saying, “This place is deserted, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “We only have here five loaves and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Bring them here to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, broke and gave the loaves to the disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitudes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled. They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who ate were about five thousand men, in addition to women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain by himself to pray. When evening had come, he was there alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, distressed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It’s a ghost!” and they cried out for fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered him and said, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the waters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Come!”
Peter stepped down from the boat and walked on the waters to come to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he saw that the wind was strong, he was afraid, and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying, “Lord, save me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they got up into the boat, the wind ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were in the boat came and worshiped him, saying, “You are truly the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people of that place recognized him, they sent into all that surrounding region and brought to him all who were sick;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment. As many as touched it were made whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Why do you also disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say, ‘Whoever may tell his father or his mother, “Whatever help you might otherwise have gotten from me is a gift devoted to God,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall not honor his father or mother.’ You have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And they worship me in vain,
    teaching as doctrine rules made by men.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He summoned the multitude, and said to them, “Hear, and understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which enters into the mouth doesn’t defile the man; but that which proceeds out of the mouth, this defiles the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, “Every plant which my heavenly Father didn’t plant will be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered him, “Explain the parable to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said, “Do you also still not understand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you understand that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the belly and then out of the body?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the things which proceed out of the mouth come out of the heart, and they defile the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual sins, thefts, false testimony, and blasphemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things which defile the man; but to eat with unwashed hands doesn’t defile the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out from there and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a Canaanite woman came out from those borders and cried, saying, “Have mercy on me, Lord, you son of David! My daughter is severely possessed by a demon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he answered her not a word.
His disciples came and begged him, saying, “Send her away; for she cries after us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, “I wasn’t sent to anyone but the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she came and worshiped him, saying, “Lord, help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, “It is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she said, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, great is your faith! Be it done to you even as you desire.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus departed from there and came near to the sea of Galilee; and he went up on the mountain and sat there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great multitudes came to him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others, and they put them down at his feet. He healed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the multitude wondered when they saw the mute speaking, the injured healed, the lame walking, and the blind seeing—and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus summoned his disciples and said, “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have continued with me now three days and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away fasting, or they might faint on the way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to him, “Where could we get so many loaves in a deserted place as to satisfy so great a multitude?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?”
They said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he took the seven loaves and the fish. He gave thanks and broke them, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were filled. They took up seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who ate were four thousand men, in addition to women and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent away the multitudes, got into the boat, and came into the borders of Magdala.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing him, asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you can’t discern the signs of the times!
