verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and there will be no sign given to it, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.”
He left them and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples came to the other side and had forgotten to take bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “We brought no bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, perceiving it, said, “Why do you reason among yourselves, you of little faith, because you have brought no bread?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you yet perceive or remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it that you don’t perceive that I didn’t speak to you concerning bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they understood that he didn’t tell them to beware of the yeast of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Some say John the Baptizer, some, Elijah, and others, Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my assembly, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give to you the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven; and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was Jesus the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time, Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, “Far be it from you, Lord! This will never be done to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, and whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste of death until they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After six days, Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John his brother, and brought them up into a high mountain by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was changed before them. His face shone like the sun, and his garments became as white as the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them talking with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, let’s make three tents here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. Behold, a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Listen to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces, and were very afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came and touched them and said, “Get up, and don’t be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, except Jesus alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Don’t tell anyone what you saw, until the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, saying, “Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Elijah indeed comes first, and will restore all things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I tell you that Elijah has come already, and they didn’t recognize him, but did to him whatever they wanted to. Even so the Son of Man will also suffer by them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them of John the Baptizer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the multitude, a man came to him, kneeling down to him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is epileptic and suffers grievously; for he often falls into the fire, and often into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I brought him to your disciples, and they could not cure him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Faithless and perverse generation! How long will I be with you? How long will I bear with you? Bring him here to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus rebuked the demon, and it went out of him, and the boy was cured from that hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately, and said, “Why weren’t we able to cast it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Because of your unbelief. For most certainly I tell you, if you have faith as a grain of mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this kind doesn’t go out except by prayer and fasting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be delivered up into the hands of men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they will kill him, and the third day he will be raised up.”
They were exceedingly sorry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had come to Capernaum, those who collected the didrachma coins came to Peter, and said, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the didrachma?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Yes.”
When he came into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth receive toll or tribute? From their children, or from strangers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter said to him, “From strangers.”
Jesus said to him, “Therefore the children are exempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go to the sea, cast a hook, and take up the first fish that comes up. When you have opened its mouth, you will find a stater coin. Take that, and give it to them for me and you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in the middle of them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you turn and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever therefore humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever receives one such little child in my name receives me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if a huge millstone were hung around his neck and that he were sunk in the depths of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that you don’t despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think? If a man has one hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, doesn’t he leave the ninety-nine, go to the mountains, and seek that which has gone astray?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he finds it, most certainly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your brother sins against you, go, show him his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained back your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he doesn’t listen, take one or two more with you, that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the assembly. If he refuses to hear the assembly also, let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, whatever things you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you release on earth will have been released in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, assuredly I tell you, that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in the middle of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came and said to him, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I don’t tell you until seven times, but, until seventy times seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had begun to settle, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because he couldn’t pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, with his wife, his children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant therefore fell down and knelt before him, saying, ‘Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him and forgave him the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would not, but went and cast him into prison until he should pay back that which was due.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told their lord all that was done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his lord called him in and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shouldn’t you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors until he should pay all that was due to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So my heavenly Father will also do to you, if you don’t each forgive your brother from your hearts for his misdeeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great multitudes followed him, and he healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharisees came to him, testing him and saying, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Haven’t you read that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘For this cause a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall be joined to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, don’t let man tear apart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Why then did Moses command us to give her a certificate of divorce and divorce her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, allowed you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it has not been so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and he who marries her when she is divorced commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “If this is the case of the man with his wife, it is not expedient to marry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “Not all men can receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven’s sake. He who is able to receive it, let him receive it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then little children were brought to him that he should lay his hands on them and pray; and the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Allow the little children, and don’t forbid them to come to me; for the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to ones like these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He laid his hands on them, and departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, one came to him and said, “Good teacher, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good but one, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to him, “Which ones?”
Jesus said, “‘You shall not murder.’ ‘You shall not commit adultery.’ ‘You shall not steal.’ ‘You shall not offer false testimony.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Honor your father and your mother.’ And, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said to him, “All these things I have observed from my youth. What do I still lack?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard this, he went away sad, for he was one who had great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to his disciples, “Most certainly I say to you, a rich man will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven with difficulty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples heard it, they were exceedingly astonished, saying, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking at them, Jesus said, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter answered, “Behold, we have left everything and followed you. What then will we have?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Most certainly I tell you that you who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man will sit on the throne of his glory, you also will sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name’s sake, will receive one hundred times, and will inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many will be last who are first, and first who are last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle. He said to them, ‘Why do you stand here all day idle?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’
“He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and you will receive whatever is right.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When those who were hired at about the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise each received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they received it, they murmured against the master of the household,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘These last have spent one hour, and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Didn’t you agree with me for a denarius?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take that which is yours, and go your way. It is my desire to give to this last just as much as to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t it lawful for me to do what I want to with what I own? Or is your eye evil, because I am good?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside, and on the way he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, to scourge, and to crucify; and the third day he will be raised up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, kneeling and asking a certain thing of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to her, “What do you want?”
She said to him, “Command that these, my two sons, may sit, one on your right hand and one on your left hand, in your Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus answered, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
They said to him, “We are able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You will indeed drink my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give, but it is for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten heard it, they were indignant with the two brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus summoned them, and said, “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall not be so among you; but whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitude rebuked them, telling them that they should be quiet, but they cried out even more, “Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stood still and called them, and asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, being moved with compassion, touched their eyes; and immediately their eyes received their sight, and they followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near to Jerusalem and came to Bethsphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and immediately he will send them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell the daughter of Zion,
    behold, your King comes to you,
    humble, and riding on a donkey,
    on a colt, the foal of a donkey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples went and did just as Jesus commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought the donkey and the colt and laid their clothes on them; and he sat on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A very great multitude spread their clothes on the road. Others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitudes who went in front of him, and those who followed, kept shouting, “Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The multitudes said, “This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered into the temple of God and drove out all of those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables and the seats of those who sold the doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a den of robbers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lame and the blind came to him in the temple, and he healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the son of David!” they were indignant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said to him, “Do you hear what these are saying?”
Jesus said to them, “Yes. Did you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of children and nursing babies, you have perfected praise’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and camped there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it, “Let there be no fruit from you forever!”
Immediately the fig tree withered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree immediately wither away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith and don’t doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it would be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching, and said, “By what authority do you do these things? Who gave you this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I also will ask you one question, which if you tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?”
They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They answered Jesus, and said, “We don’t know.”
He also said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first, and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he changed his mind, and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I’m going, sir,’ but he didn’t go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which of the two did the will of his father?”
They said to him, “The first.”
Jesus said to them, “Most certainly I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into God’s Kingdom before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn’t believe him; but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn’t even repent afterward, that you might believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a wine press in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the season for the fruit came near, he sent his servants to the farmers to receive his fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first; and they treated them the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and seize his inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard, then killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him, “He will miserably destroy those miserable men, and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers who will give him the fruit in its season.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Did you never read in the Scriptures,
‘The stone which the builders rejected
    was made the head of the corner.
This was from the Lord.
    It is marvelous in our eyes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore I tell you, God’s Kingdom will be taken away from you and will be given to a nation producing its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it will fall, it will scatter him as dust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spoke about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they sought to seize him, they feared the multitudes, because they considered him to be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and spoke to them again in parables, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who made a wedding feast for his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding feast, but they would not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My cattle and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the wedding feast!”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his merchandise;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the rest grabbed his servants, treated them shamefully, and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king heard that, he was angry, and sent his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned their city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited weren’t worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore to the intersections of the highways, and as many as you may find, invite to the wedding feast.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those servants went out into the highways and gathered together as many as they found, both bad and good. The wedding was filled with guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man who didn’t have on wedding clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here not wearing wedding clothing?’ He was speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and throw him into the outer darkness. That is where the weeping and grinding of teeth will be.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many are called, but few chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went and took counsel how they might entrap him in his talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and teach the way of God in truth, no matter whom you teach; for you aren’t partial to anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us therefore, what do you think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, “Why do you test me, you hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show me the tax money.”
They brought to him a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Whose is this image and inscription?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said to him, “Caesar’s.”
Then he said to them, “Give therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard it, they marveled, and left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Sadducees (those who say that there is no resurrection) came to him. They asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first married and died, and having no offspring left his wife to his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, the second also, and the third, to the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After them all, the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection therefore, whose wife will she be of the seven? For they all had her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, “You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like God’s angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven’t you read that which was spoken to you by God, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, gathered themselves together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, a lawyer, asked him a question, testing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the first and great commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A second likewise is this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole law and the prophets depend on these two commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “What do you think of the Christ? Whose son is he?”
They said to him, “Of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    sit on my right hand,
    until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If then David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one was able to answer him a word, neither did any man dare ask him any more questions from that day forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees sit on Moses’ seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things therefore whatever they tell you to observe, observe and do, but don’t do their works; for they say, and don’t do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they bind heavy burdens that are grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not lift a finger to help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they do all their works to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad and enlarge the fringes of their garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and love the place of honor at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the salutations in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi, Rabbi’ by men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi’, for one is your teacher, the Christ, and all of you are brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Call no man on the earth your father, for one is your Father, he who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither be called masters, for one is your master, the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who is greatest among you will be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and as a pretense you make long prayers. Therefore you will receive greater condemnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men; for you don’t enter in yourselves, neither do you allow those who are entering in to enter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel around by sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of Gehenna as yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, you blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind fools! For which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind fools! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the gift?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He therefore who swears by the altar, swears by it and by everything on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who swears by the temple, swears by it and by him who has been living in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God and by him who sits on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint, dill, and cumin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. But you ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and of the platter, that its outside may become clean also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men’s bones and of all uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the tombs of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we wouldn’t have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You serpents, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of Gehenna?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues and persecute from city to city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the sanctuary and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I would have gathered your children together, even as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you would not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you, you will not see me from now on, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went out from the temple, and was going on his way. His disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “You see all of these things, don’t you? Most certainly I tell you, there will not be left here one stone on another, that will not be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will lead many astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you aren’t troubled, for all this must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there will be famines, plagues, and earthquakes in various places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will deliver you up to oppression and will kill you. You will be hated by all of the nations for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many will stumble, and will deliver up one another, and will hate one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many false prophets will arise and will lead many astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because iniquity will be multiplied, the love of many will grow cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who endures to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Good News of the Kingdom will be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When, therefore, you see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take out the things that are in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to get his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to those who are with child and to nursing mothers in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that your flight will not be in the winter nor on a Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for then there will be great suffering, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then if any man tells you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘There!’ don’t believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false christs and false prophets will arise, and they will show great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I have told you beforehand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If therefore they tell you, ‘Behold, he is in the wilderness,’ don’t go out; or ‘Behold, he is in the inner rooms,’ don’t believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the lightning flashes from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For wherever the carcass is, that is where the vultures gather together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But immediately after the suffering of those days, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will send out his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now from the fig tree learn this parable: When its branch has now become tender and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so you also, when you see all these things, know that he is near, even at the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things are accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But no one knows of that day and hour, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the days of Noah were, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in those days which were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they didn’t know until the flood came and took them all away, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken and one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken and one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know in what hour your Lord comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore also be ready, for in an hour that you don’t expect, the Son of Man will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his lord has set over his household, to give them their food in due season?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord finds doing so when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you that he will set him over all that he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil servant should say in his heart, ‘My lord is delaying his coming,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and begins to beat his fellow servants, and eat and drink with the drunkards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he doesn’t expect it and in an hour when he doesn’t know it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cut him in pieces and appoint his portion with the hypocrites. That is where the weeping and grinding of teeth will be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wise answered, saying, ‘What if there isn’t enough for us and you? You go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding feast, and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, ‘Most certainly I tell you, I don’t know you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For it is like a man going into another country, who called his own servants and entrusted his goods to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one, to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, he also who got the two gained another two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who received the one talent went away and dug in the earth and hid his lord’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and settled accounts with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who received the five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five talents in addition to them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He also who got the two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents in addition to them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things. I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He also who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you that you are a hard man, reaping where you didn’t sow, and gathering where you didn’t scatter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But his lord answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow, and gather where I didn’t scatter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take away therefore the talent from him and give it to him who has the ten talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have abundance, but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throw out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the King will tell those on his right hand, ‘Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was hungry and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty and you gave me drink. I was a stranger and you took me in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was naked and you clothed me. I was sick and you visited me. I was in prison and you came to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you a drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we see you as a stranger and take you in, or naked and clothe you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we see you sick or in prison and come to you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The King will answer them, ‘Most certainly I tell you, because you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was hungry, and you didn’t give me food to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me no drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and you didn’t take me in; naked, and you didn’t clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you didn’t visit me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will also answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn’t help you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Most certainly I tell you, because you didn’t do it to one of the least of these, you didn’t do it to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished all these words, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took counsel together that they might take Jesus by deceit and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “Not during the feast, lest a riot occur among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a woman came to him having an alabaster jar of very expensive ointment, and she poured it on his head as he sat at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when his disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this ointment might have been sold for much and given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, knowing this, Jesus said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? She has done a good work for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you, but you don’t always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in pouring this ointment on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be spoken of as a memorial of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver him to you?” So they weighed out for him thirty pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time he sought opportunity to betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying to him, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Go into the city to a certain person, and tell him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is at hand. I will keep the Passover at your house with my disciples.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening had come, he was reclining at the table with the twelve disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, he said, “Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were exceedingly sorrowful, and each began to ask him, “It isn’t me, is it, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “He who dipped his hand with me in the dish will betray me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man goes even as it is written of him, but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judas, who betrayed him, answered, “It isn’t me, is it, Rabbi?”
He said to him, “You said it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks for it, and broke it. He gave to the disciples and said, “Take, eat; this is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the cup, gave thanks, and gave to them, saying, “All of you drink it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many for the remission of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you that I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on, until that day when I drink it anew with you in my Father’s Kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter answered him, “Even if all will be made to stumble because of you, I will never be made to stumble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you that tonight, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Even if I must die with you, I will not deny you.” All of the disciples also said likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples, “Sit here, while I go there and pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and severely troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went forward a little, fell on his face, and prayed, saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass away from me; nevertheless, not what I desire, but what you desire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “What, couldn’t you watch with me for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray, that you don’t enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, a second time he went away and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cup can’t pass away from me unless I drink it, your desire be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left them again, went away, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to his disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise, let’s be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whoever I kiss, he is the one. Seize him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he came to Jesus, and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to him, “Friend, why are you here?”
Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place, for all those who take the sword will die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you think that I couldn’t ask my Father, and he would even now send me more than twelve legions of angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it must be so?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, “Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But all this has happened that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.”
Then all the disciples left him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had taken Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter followed him from a distance to the court of the high priest, and entered in and sat with the officers, to see the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests, the elders, and the whole council sought false testimony against Jesus, that they might put him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they found none. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest stood up and said to him, “Have you no answer? What is this that these testify against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus stayed silent. The high priest answered him, “I adjure you by the living God that you tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have said so. Nevertheless, I tell you, after this you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of the sky.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his clothing, saying, “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Behold, now you have heard his blasphemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What do you think?”
They answered, “He is worthy of death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spat in his face and beat him with their fists, and some slapped him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Prophesy to us, you Christ! Who hit you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the court, and a maid came to him, saying, “You were also with Jesus, the Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I don’t know what you are talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone out onto the porch, someone else saw him and said to those who were there, “This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he denied it with an oath, “I don’t know the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a little while those who stood by came and said to Peter, “Surely you are also one of them, for your speech makes you known.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he began to curse and to swear, “I don’t know the man!”
Immediately the rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” Then he went out and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when morning had come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They bound him, led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas, who betrayed him, when he saw that Jesus was condemned, felt remorse, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood.”
But they said, “What is that to us? You see to it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He threw down the pieces of silver in the sanctuary and departed. Then he went away and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver and said, “It’s not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took counsel, and bought the potter’s field with them to bury strangers in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that field has been called “The Field of Blood” to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,
“They took the thirty pieces of silver,
    the price of him upon whom a price had been set,
    whom some of the children of Israel priced,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they gave them for the potter’s field,
    as the Lord commanded me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jesus stood before the governor; and the governor asked him, saying, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
Jesus said to him, “So you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to him, “Don’t you hear how many things they testify against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him no answer, not even one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release to the multitude one prisoner whom they desired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had then a notable prisoner called Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that because of envy they had delivered him up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have suffered many things today in a dream because of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes to ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the governor answered them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?”
They said, “Barabbas!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said to them, “What then shall I do to Jesus who is called Christ?”
They all said to him, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the governor said, “Why? What evil has he done?”
But they cried out exceedingly, saying, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Pilate saw that nothing was being gained, but rather that a disturbance was starting, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this righteous person. You see to it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people answered, “May his blood be on us and on our children!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he released Barabbas to them, but Jesus he flogged and delivered to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him and mocked him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spat on him, and took the reed and struck him on the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name, and they compelled him to go with them, that he might carry his cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to a place called “Golgotha”, that is to say, “The place of a skull,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gave him sour wine to drink mixed with gall. When he had tasted it, he would not drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they sat and watched him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set up over his head the accusation against him written, “THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “You who destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise the chief priests also mocking with the scribes, the Pharisees, and the elders, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others, but he can’t save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lima sabachthani?” That is, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said, “This man is calling Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately one of them ran and took a sponge, filled it with vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest said, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to save him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom. The earth quaked and the rocks were split.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the centurion and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things that were done, were terrified, saying, “Truly this was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many women were there watching from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, a rich man from Arimathaea named Joseph, who himself was also Jesus’ disciple, came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock. Then he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: ‘After three days I will rise again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, ‘He is risen from the dead;’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you can.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from the sky and came and rolled away the stone from the door and sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For fear of him, the guards shook, and became like dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered the women, “Don’t be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus, who has been crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, for he has risen, just like he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.’ Behold, I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!”
They came and took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid. Go tell my brothers that they should go into Galilee, and there they will see me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were assembled with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave a large amount of silver to the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Say that his disciples came by night and stole him away while we slept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this comes to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him and make you free of worry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took the money and did as they were told. This saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continues until today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw him, they bowed down to him; but some doubted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came to them and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: teaching them to observe all things that I commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
